00022 // is not available anyway, so we don't need to even

00031 // implementation for wchar_t
00032 
00033 // Translate incoming UTF-8 into UCS-4
00034 std::codecvt_base::result utf8_codecvt_facet::do_in(
00035     std::mbstate_t& /*state*/, 
00036     const char * from,
00037     const char * from_end, 
00038     const char * & from_next,
00039     wchar_t * to, 
00040     wchar_t * to_end, 
00041     wchar_t * & to_next
00042 ) const {
00043     // Basic algorithm:  The first octet determines how many
00044     // octets total make up the UCS-4 character.  The remaining
00045     // "continuing octets" all begin with "10". To convert, subtract
00046     // the amount that specifies the number of octets from the first
00047     // octet.  Subtract 0x80 (1000 0000) from each continuing octet,
00048     // then mash the whole lot together.  Note that each continuing
00049     // octet only uses 6 bits as unique values, so only shift by
00050     // multiples of 6 to combine.
00051     while (from != from_end && to != to_end) {
00052 
00053         // Error checking   on the first octet
00054         if (invalid_leading_octet(*from)){
00055             from_next = from;
00056             to_next = to;
00057             return std::codecvt_base::error;
00058         }
00059 
00060         // The first octet is   adjusted by a value dependent upon 
00061         // the number   of "continuing octets" encoding the character
00062         const   int cont_octet_count = get_cont_octet_count(*from);
00063         const   wchar_t octet1_modifier_table[] =   {
00064             0x00, 0xc0, 0xe0, 0xf0, 0xf8, 0xfc
00065         };
00066 
00067         // The unsigned char conversion is necessary in case char is
00068         // signed   (I learned this the hard way)
00069         wchar_t ucs_result = 
00070             (unsigned char)(*from++) - octet1_modifier_table[cont_octet_count];
00071 
00072         // Invariants   : 
00073         //   1) At the start of the loop,   'i' continuing characters have been
00074         //    processed 
00075         //   2) *from   points to the next continuing character to be processed.
00076         int i   = 0;
00077         while(i != cont_octet_count && from != from_end) {
00078 
00079             // Error checking on continuing characters
00080             if (invalid_continuing_octet(*from)) {
00081                 from_next   = from;
00082                 to_next =   to;
00083                 return std::codecvt_base::error;
00084             }
00085 
00086             ucs_result *= (1 << 6); 
00087 
00088             // each continuing character has an extra (10xxxxxx)b attached to 
00089             // it that must be removed.
00090             ucs_result += (unsigned char)(*from++) - 0x80;
00091             ++i;
00092         }
00093 
00094         // If   the buffer ends with an incomplete unicode character...
00095         if (from == from_end && i   != cont_octet_count) {
00096             // rewind "from" to before the current character translation
00097             from_next = from - (i+1); 
00098             to_next = to;
00099             return std::codecvt_base::partial;
00100         }
00101         *to++   = ucs_result;
00102     }
00103     from_next = from;
00104     to_next = to;
00105 
00106     // Were we done converting or did we run out of destination space?
00107     if(from == from_end) return std::codecvt_base::ok;
00108     else return std::codecvt_base::partial;
00109 }
00110 
00111 std::codecvt_base::result utf8_codecvt_facet::do_out(
00112     std::mbstate_t& /*state*/, 
00113     const wchar_t *   from,
00114     const wchar_t * from_end, 
00115     const wchar_t * & from_next,
00116     char * to, 
00117     char * to_end, 
00118     char * & to_next
00119 ) const
00120 {
00121     // RG - consider merging this table with the other one
00122     const wchar_t octet1_modifier_table[] = {
00123         0x00, 0xc0, 0xe0, 0xf0, 0xf8, 0xfc
00124     };
00125 
00126     wchar_t max_wchar = (std::numeric_limits<wchar_t>::max)();
00127     while (from != from_end && to != to_end) {
00128 
00129         // Check for invalid UCS-4 character
00130         if (*from  > max_wchar) {
00131             from_next = from;
00132             to_next = to;
00133             return std::codecvt_base::error;
00134         }
00135 
00136         int cont_octet_count = get_cont_octet_out_count(*from);
00137 
00138         // RG  - comment this formula better
00139         int shift_exponent = (cont_octet_count) *   6;
00140 
00141         // Process the first character
00142         *to++ = static_cast<char>(octet1_modifier_table[cont_octet_count] +
00143             (unsigned char)(*from / (1 << shift_exponent)));
00144 
00145         // Process the continuation characters 
00146         // Invariants: At   the start of the loop:
00147         //   1) 'i' continuing octets   have been generated
00148         //   2) '*to'   points to the next location to place an octet
00149         //   3) shift_exponent is   6 more than needed for the next octet
00150         int i   = 0;
00151         while   (i != cont_octet_count && to != to_end) {
00152             shift_exponent -= 6;
00153             *to++ = static_cast<char>(0x80 + ((*from / (1 << shift_exponent)) % (1 << 6)));
00154             ++i;
00155         }
00156         // If   we filled up the out buffer before encoding the character
00157         if(to   == to_end && i != cont_octet_count) {
00158             from_next = from;
00159             to_next = to - (i+1);
00160             return std::codecvt_base::partial;
00161         }
00162         *from++;
00163     }
00164     from_next = from;
00165     to_next = to;
00166     // Were we done or did we run out of destination space
00167     if(from == from_end) return std::codecvt_base::ok;
00168     else return std::codecvt_base::partial;
00169 }

00171 // How many char objects can I process to get <= max_limit
00172 // wchar_t objects?
00173 int utf8_codecvt_facet::do_length(
00174     BOOST_CODECVT_DO_LENGTH_CONST std::mbstate_t &,
00175     const char * from,
00176     const char * from_end, 
00177     std::size_t max_limit
00178 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__IBMCPP__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(600))
00179 ) const throw()
00180 #else
00181 ) const
00182 #endif
00183 { 
00184     // RG - this code is confusing!  I need a better way to express it.
00185     // and test cases.
00186 
00187     // Invariants:
00188     // 1) last_octet_count has the size of the last measured character
00189     // 2) char_count holds the number of characters shown to fit
00190     // within the bounds so far (no greater than max_limit)
00191     // 3) from_next points to the octet 'last_octet_count' before the
00192     // last measured character.  
00193     int last_octet_count=0;
00194     std::size_t char_count = 0;
00195     const char* from_next = from;
00196     // Use "<" because the buffer may represent incomplete characters
00197     while (from_next+last_octet_count <= from_end && char_count <= max_limit) {
00198         from_next += last_octet_count;
00199         last_octet_count = (get_octet_count(*from_next));
00200         ++char_count;
00201     }
00202     return static_cast<int>(from_next-from_end);
00203 }
00204 
00205 unsigned int utf8_codecvt_facet::get_octet_count(
00206     unsigned char   lead_octet
00207 ){
00208     // if the 0-bit (MSB) is 0, then 1 character
00209     if (lead_octet <= 0x7f) return 1;
00210 
00211     // Otherwise the count number of consecutive 1 bits starting at MSB
00212 //    assert(0xc0 <= lead_octet && lead_octet <= 0xfd);
00213 
00214     if (0xc0 <= lead_octet && lead_octet <= 0xdf) return 2;
00215     else if (0xe0 <= lead_octet && lead_octet <= 0xef) return 3;
00216     else if (0xf0 <= lead_octet && lead_octet <= 0xf7) return 4;
00217     else if (0xf8 <= lead_octet && lead_octet <= 0xfb) return 5;
00218     else return 6;
00219 }
00220 BOOST_UTF8_END_NAMESPACE
00221 
00222 namespace {
00223 template<std::size_t s>
00224 int get_cont_octet_out_count_impl(wchar_t word){
00225     if (word < 0x80) {
00226         return 0;
00227     }
00228     if (word < 0x800) {
00229         return 1;
00230     }
00231     return 2;
00232 }
00233 
00234 // note the following code will generate on some platforms where
00235 // wchar_t is defined as UCS2.  The warnings are superfluous as
00236 // the specialization is never instantitiated with such compilers.
00237 template<>
00238 int get_cont_octet_out_count_impl<4>(wchar_t word){
00239     if (word < 0x80) {
00240         return 0;
00241     }
00242     if (word < 0x800) {
00243         return 1;
00244     }
00245     if (word < 0x10000) {
00246         return 2;
00247     }
00248     if (word < 0x200000) {
00249         return 3;
00250     }
00251     if (word < 0x4000000) {
00252         return 4;
00253     }
00254     return 5;
00255 }
00256 
00257 } // namespace anonymous

00259 BOOST_UTF8_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00260 // How many "continuing octets" will be needed for this word
00261 // ==   total octets - 1.
00262 int utf8_codecvt_facet::get_cont_octet_out_count(
00263     wchar_t word
00264 ) const {
00265     return get_cont_octet_out_count_impl<sizeof(wchar_t)>(word);
00266 }
00267 BOOST_UTF8_END_NAMESPACE

00269 #endif
